c74object.name: growbuffer~
c74object.digest: Resize one or more buffers while preserving data
c74object.description: The `growbuffer~` object allows for resizing a single `buffer~` or a set of `buffer~` members within a `polybuffer~`. It preserves existing data during the resize by backing it up to memory and restoring it afterward.

inlet.description: - bang: Reports the current length of the buffer(s) in milliseconds. - float/int: Resizes the buffer(s) to the specified length in milliseconds. - set [name]: Changes the target buffer or polybuffer prefix.
Sets the target buffer or polybuffer prefix.

outlet.description: Outputs status and error messages from the buffer operations.
If the verbose attribute is enabled, this outlet provides detailed diagnostic logs.

objarg.name: buffer-name
objarg.digest: Initial buffer name or polybuffer prefix

method.name: bang
method.description: Triggers a report of the current buffer length in milliseconds.

method.name: float
method.description: Resizes the buffer(s) to the specified length in milliseconds.

method.name: int
method.description: Resizes the buffer(s) to the specified length in milliseconds.

method.name: set
method.description: Sets the target buffer name or polybuffer prefix.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: When enabled (1), creates an additional outlet for status information.
